messageBody:
Nusrat Hasan wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I understand it is not a JUnit problem. But if I use the <java> task I don't
> think I can get the
> JUnit reports generated by Ant. Is there a way to get it?

Not without customizing a task, I don't think.

> I am using main() since I can't find any way to run the same testcases with
> with different data.

You want a Parameterized Test Case. See the book JUnit Recipes, chapter
4 or search the archives here or search the web.

> I looked at the archives also but found some solution which will work if I
> had only 1 test method
> to run and pass all the arguments. But I need to run all the methods in 1
> class file.

Aha. Well, the easiest thing to do is to create a test case class for
each test method. All the test case classes can inherit the fixture
definition from a common abstract base class. The alternative solutions
are clunky at best, which is why I haven't written about them.

> Please let me know if anyone has a solution.

I think your best bet, based on the tools available and your current
constraints, is to do what I've just suggested.

Good luck.
